result.execSummary:
The defendant Travell Javon McCoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).
  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amounts of $5531 payable to Teresa R., $3606.82 payable to Eli and Cheryl M. joint and several with Colten Lazarski.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

supervisions.notes: Extended supervision conditions apply to both counts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 436 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing NOVEMBER 20, 2015 received and filed. (39 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to PRISON

Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, with credit for 436 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 436 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant to maintain employment.
Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amounts of $5531 payable to Teresa Rode, $3606.82 payable to Eli and Cheryl Morren joint and several with Colten Lazarski.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Travell Javon McCoy not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per Judge McAdams this case can be adjourned off the record. Court in trial and parties would like this sentencing to remain before this court. This sentencing is expected to last 2 or more hours.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State informed the court that witnesses are unavailable on 10.16.15. Case rescheduled to 10.20.15 to allow witnesses to be present.
Parties contacted the court to adjourn sentencing as court is in trial and parties will like for this case to remain before this court. Judge McAdams approves this off the record adjournment.
Parties contacted the court to adjourn sentencing as court is in trial and parties will like for this case to remain before this court. Judge McAdams approves this off the record adjournment.

Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1-2:  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Travell Javon McCoy not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7. Jury Trial and Final Pretrial will be rescheduled on next court date.

Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Arguments heard as to the State's joinder motion. Court granted State's motion and ordered this case be joined with 14CF4026. Court ordered the final pretrial date in this matter be adjourned until after judicial rotation. Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/17/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, Defendant's Response To State's Motion For Joinder
State's Motion for Joinder with case 14CF4026 received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Travell Javon McCoy not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing. Defense counsel has not received discovery from the State. Court ordered this matter be scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial dates. State will be filing a joinder motion with defendant's other pending case (14CF4026) in Branch 15. State to file joinder motion by 5/05/15. Defense to file any motions and written response to State's joinder motion by 5/15/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/31/2015 received and filed. (25 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Craig Powell, 735 N. Water St., Ste. 1212 Milwaukee, WI 53202. mt

Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brett Mendola-Oak Creek Police Department Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Travell Javon McCoy in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
